attributes.action: Remove Theresa May’s PDCA if Brexit reduces economic growth
attributes.background: According to the Huffington Post, Prime Ministers are able to take advantage of a generous allowance of £148000 a year upon leaving office. We believe that in the case where Brexit causes the economy to reduce by any amount, Theresa May should not be entitled to the ‘Public Duties Cost Allowance’

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Public Duty Cost Allowance (PDCA) is available to former Prime Ministers for "reimbursement of incurred expenses for necessary office costs and secretarial costs arising from their special position in public life", up to a limit of £115,000 per year. Amounts claimed in 2015/16 and 2016/17 are published here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/647027/page_87_public_duty_cost_allowance.csv/preview

There's already a petition calling for the PDCA to be stopped, which you might like to sign.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
